main event: Three round red objects were seen in a line, resembling stars and were observed for about three minutes. The conclusion was that it was likely a weather balloon with lights.
interesting points: The sighting occurred in Marietta, Ga. on December 2nd, 1957 and lasted for 2-3 minutes.
The objects were described as motionless and very high, with a direction of 250 degrees from Atlanta.
The report suggests that the existence of three objects was probably an illusion due to the movements of the balloon.
The direction of movement due to winds would have been away from the observer, resulting in no change in azimuth detected by the observer.
The sighting was initially thought to be three round red objects, which were later believed to be a weather balloon with lights.
sighted object: three round red objects in a line
